session_title: C Course Complete Consolidation & GitHub Preparation
context: Consolidating entire C programming course (50_CSc) from scattered files across system into unified structure for GitHub portfolio
turning_point_prompt:
User Query: "Extract all C programming course content from /Users/trevabbott/bayFamilyVault/schoolMediaTrev/10_codeLibrary/C_++/50_CSc into compressed JSON. Include all .c/.h files with full content, all .md/.txt docs. Mark duplicates (files with 'copy' suffix, iterations like draft2/test2). Output valid JSON."

Context: User had 270 C source files scattered across assignments, with duplicates, multiple versions, and needed everything consolidated with Canvas course data for GitHub setup following dev-workflow-docs standards.

Breakthrough: Realized need to map Canvas assignments (REQUIREMENTS) to local files (SOLUTIONS), then use PDF submission timestamps as "last touch" to reconstruct Git history backwards.

commands_developed.purpose: Global code audit - find every code file on system
commands_developed.why: Need complete inventory before deduplication and organization

commands_developed.purpose: Filter to specific course files (270 files)
commands_developed.why: Narrow scope to relevant files for this consolidation
commands_developed.result: Complete map of all C course files

commands_developed.why: Need to extract C code from PDF submissions to verify completeness
Identify which assignment each PDF contains by reading actual code
commands_developed.discovery: PDFs labeled incorrectly - needed content verification

commands_developed.purpose: Parse all .c/.h files and build structured JSON
commands_developed.contains: All source code with full content, organized by assignment/problem/file

commands_developed.purpose: Parse Canvas HTML export and extract lessons/assignments
commands_developed.contains: 23 modules, 171 pages, 11 assignments with full descriptions

workflow_evolution.phase_1: Initial extraction - discovered local files were SOLUTIONS to Canvas REQUIREMENTS
workflow_evolution.phase_2: Cross-referencing - matched Canvas assignments to local implementations
workflow_evolution.phase_3: PDF hunt - found all missing submission PDFs in /code_audit/missing pdfs/
workflow_evolution.phase_4: Timeline reconstruction - used PDF timestamps as 'last touch' dates
workflow_evolution.phase_5: Git history inference - identified draft2/test2 as intermediate commits

key_discoveries: HW7 is actually a second draft of HW5 (bitcoin), not separate assignment
annotated-main.c.pdf is HW6/7 (File I/O with candy data)
Quiz 2 had 2 PDFs - original + annotated supplemental
All 270 files map to 12 assignments (CheckIn + 6 HW + 2 Quiz + Midterm + Final)

c_class_extracted.json.contains: All local C source code with full content

canvas_course_extracted.json.contains: Complete Canvas export - modules, pages, assignments

pdf_submission_map.json.contains: Mapping of all 42 PDF submissions to assignments

50_csc_complete_file_map.txt.contains: All 270 C course file paths from global audit

c_course_unified.json.status: FINAL OUTPUT - ready for GitHub agent
includes: Inferred Git commit history from timestamps

git_reconstruction_strategy.principle: Work backwards from PDF submissions (last touch) to source files (iterations)
git_reconstruction_strategy.timeline: PDF timestamp = final commit date for each assignment

branches.feature/arrays-conway: HW3 - Arrays and Conway's Game of Life

for_github_agent.instructions: This JSON contains EVERYTHING needed to set up c-intro-50-csc repo
includes: All source code paths and content
Inferred Git commit history with dates
